title: Senior Solution Architect
description:
**Company:** Automatech
  
  

About US
  
AutomaTech is a leading provider of industrial technology solutions focused on improving your operational performance. By harnessing the power of data, we enable significant gains, visibility across your entire organization, and increased profits for a competitive edge. Our product offering includes a flexible and scalable mix of hardware and software solutions to solve your toughest challenges while providing a road map for future improvements and growth. More importantly, we stand behind all our solutions with superior and ongoing support for the lifetime of your products, helping you maximize your investment and operational potential.
  
Our team is passionate about guiding customers through their industrial applications, no matter the size, scope, or obstacles you face. We place a high priority on conducting our business in an ethical manner, from the way that we interact with each other, our customers, and our partners to how we relate to each professional scenario and process. We are focused on performing our job functions with excellence, being honest, reliable, and accessible in all our business dealings. We care about our customers and strive to consistently offer exceptional product knowledge and support to help design, implement, and support their investments.
  
  

Summary
  
**1. Purpose:** This is a high impact customer facing role.
  
* As a Sr. Solution Architect, be a lead in driving the technical and application discussions with existing and new customers for Industrial AI, SCADA, MES, and Digital Transformation engagements. In short, help the commercial team drive technical solutions that solve problems for customers.


Work with the sales team to proactively drive customer facing activities in four areas:
  
* Technical Events and Customer Meetings (meetings, product and technology updates, webinars, etc.).
* Build and develop solutions for customers that include Bill of Materials and Proposal Development.
* Product and Technology Roadmaps that drive solution sales and project work.
* Development of sales collaterals to be used in the activities listed above.
* Learn, Innovate, Grow – Be the product and technology champion for our team.


**2. Function:**  

* Have Solution Architects be the go-to team for knowledge in the core areas that ATI is growing in:
* Core Technology Application Areas: Controls, SCADA, OT Security, MES, Analytics, High Availability Compute Platforms and control centric platforms like PLCs and VFDs.
* Collect, prioritize, and convert sales materials for the Core Technology Areas – the team needs to be able to shape, lead and advise viewpoints and discussions with customers in these areas.
* Plan, coordinate, and setup presales solution architecture activities with the sales team
* Maintain a strong communication channel with vendors and update sales team with solution applications. Therefore, be the Product and Technology liaison with our core vendors and sales team members


Responsibilities
  
* Lead and manage technical pre-sales activities – help us drive growth!
* Be part of weekly rhythm and cadence with the team including tracking metrics in a dashboard.
* Act as the go to person with key vendors to disseminate and teach others in our organization on their products, technologies and applications long with customer targets. This task will help drive sales-enablement.
* Support and co-develop quotes and proposals


#automatech
  
#LI-JS
  
#FCG-L
  
  

No Agencies, Please

title: Manual Tester
description:
Description:

The Tester will participate in the planning, constructing, review and execution of test scripts to support the overall project.


The Tester will:

* Work with developers and other team members to identify and architect tests/test plans, support review of tests, execute tests, document results, and log and triage defects.
* Ensure test environments are set up accurately prior to test execution.
* Create test data, as necessary, to support proper execution of all test cases.
* Retest test cases and close out software defects that have been repaired.
* Execute regression testing, as necessary.
* Identify and report issues that may adversely impact timely completion of testing.


Requirements:

Required Skills/Experience:

* Minimum 6 mos. - 1 year experience in manual testing (application, product, system, regression testing)
* Experience working in an agile environment
* Test Planning
* Test Execution
* JIRA

title: Senior Solution Architect - Presales
description:
**Role: Presales Solutions Architect**

**Location: Remote**

**Pay Rate: $80-130k base + (Commission puts OTE at $200k+)**

**Duration: Permanent**

**Keys**

* Prior experience in Presales Solution Architecture
* 5+ years of client facing experience
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
* Proven experience as a Solutions Architect or a similar role, with a focus on pre-sales activities.
* Strong expertise in AWS and Azure cloud platforms, including certification in one or both.
* In-depth understanding of SaaS and cloud-based solutions.
* Experience with CRM and sales enablement tools is a plus.

**Duties**

* Work closely with the sales team to understand customer requirements and identify opportunities for our SaaS solutions.
* Design and present customized technical solutions based on customer needs, leveraging AWS and Azure services.
* Create detailed architecture diagrams, documentation, and proposals to communicate the proposed solutions effectively.
* Conduct technical presentations and product demonstrations to prospective clients.
* Collaborate with the product development team to provide feedback on customer requirements and contribute to product improvement.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and developments in AWS and Azure services, as well as our SaaS products.
* Assist in responding to RFPs (Request for Proposals) and RFIs (Request for Information).
* Act as a trusted advisor to customers, building strong relationships and ensuring customer satisfaction throughout the sales cycle.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $110,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Commission pay

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Pre-sales: 5 years (Required)
* Solution architecture: 5 years (Required)
* client facing: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Pre-Sales Solution Architect
description:
* **This role is 100% remote. Candidates can live anywhere in the US.**
* Is aware of the broader strategy for Advisory product sales, based on high level of product knowledge and frequent interactions with customers and account management teams
* Supports primary sellers in relationship building, lending technical credibility with customer buyers
* Works hands-on with customers pre-sale to gather solution requirements and demonstrate and communicate implementation best practices
* Works independently on service demonstrations and provides reassurance that the Service will work effectively and deliver value in the customer’s environment
* Interfaces with technical customer personnel to communicate value of solution in detail
* Delivers technical presentations of offerings to customers and prospects
* Assists with scope creation based upon customer requirements
* Provides sales support as a subject matter expert to the sales team and for inbound opportunities
* Works with account teams, provides new perspectives to existing solutions to existing and prospective customers, as well as New Account Executives, to demonstrate value of UL services
* Leverages technical knowledge to partner with sellers to drive overall solution win
* Supports hand-off to Operations team to ensure proper scope execution
* The target annual pay range for this position is $99,400. - $106,500. which includes a base salary of $70,000 - $75,000 and 100% on target performance. Members of the sales function are eligible to participate in the UL Solutions Sales Incentive Plan. The annual target incentive for this position is 42% of the base salary, paid quarterly, and is contingent upon performance. Employees are eligible for health benefits such as medical, dental and vision; wellness benefits such as mental & financial health; and retirement savings (401K) commensurate with the standard rewards offered in each individual location or country, for the relevant position level.
* We also provide employees with paid time off including vacation (15 days), holiday including floating holidays (12 days) and sick time off (72 hours).
* Internal applicants with questions related to the Total Rewards for this position should submit a ticket via askHR for more insights.

#LI-Remote


  
* Bachelors and/or graduate degree in scientific or related field
* 5+ years of related experience
* Relevant technical capabilities in the built environment
* Deep knowledge and experience with assigned specialty Advisory services

title: Kinaxis Solution Architect
description:
**Role: Kinaxis Solution Architect**

**Location: Remote**

**Duration: 12 months + Extension**

Job Summary:  
We are looking for a Kinaxis Rapid Response (RR) solution architect who can champion the design & delivery of the advanced solution capabilities. This is a high impact, individual contributor role having a high visibility within the business & IT stakeholders. The individual will be the key driver of the RR implementation, rollouts, continuous improvements, and applications support. The individual needs to be self-motivated, having hands-on experience in advanced RR capabilities, willing to take on complex requirements and develop solutions. The role requires excellent verbal & written communication skills and ability to build relationships at all levels of the business & IT organizations.

**Responsibilities:**

* A hands-on role, architect the complete the end-to-end supply chain planning solution using the Kinaxis RR platform.
* Develop long term enterprise strategy for the roll-out of the Kinaxis RR platform.
* Delivery proof of concept ideas/projects to improve / deploy functionalities.
* Establish industry best & standard RR processes.
* Hands on experience in guiding the solution configuration, troubleshooting technical/functional issues during the implementation.
* Implement continuous process improvements after the implementation.
* Design and deploy latest technology like advanced analytics, AI, machine learning to advance our Supply Chain and solve complex challenges (e.g., inventory optimization, S&OP simplification, others)
* Identity and implement continuous process improvements

**Skills & Experience**

* 10+ years of experience in Supply Chain Planning Solutions such as Demand Planning, Supply Planning, S&OP, and the like, with 4+ years of experience in Kinaxis Rapid Response
* Strong functional and RR analytics knowledge in Demand Planning, Supply & Production Planning, Inventory optimization, Constrained Planning, Sales, and Operations Planning (S&OP).
* Solution Architect! for at least two complete Kinaxis RR implementation projects.
* Possess good understanding of Kinaxis Rapid Response data management, data modeling, key control settings and analytics, with the exposure to integrating legacy data, or spreadsheets and data management in

Kinaxis Rapid Response.

* Hands-on experience maintaining Kinaxis Solutions & Environments and configuring Workbooks, Worksheets, Reports, Forms and Scripts in Rapid Response based on the solution design requirements.
* Deep knowledge in Kinaxis RR integration with SAP
* Candidates with domain knowledge in Retail/Wholesale Retail/Manufacturing preferred.
* Demonstrate excellent Business Process knowledge with strong people skills to implement Kinaxis for new and existing businesses and from a Support and Sustenance standpoint.
* Any prior experience with similar planning applications is a nice to have like SAP IBP, o9, Blueyonder, others.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: $100.00 - $120.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Experience:

* Software development: 1 year (Preferred)
* Salesforce: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Data Architect
description:
Great Culture, Great People, Great Company
  
If you’re looking for a company that’s big enough to have exciting and challenging business opportunities, yet small enough to make a personal impact – WoodmenLife may be the place for you.
  
We’ve been a fixture in downtown Omaha over 130 years, and we promote a family-first environment with flexible work schedules, a team-oriented atmosphere, and a culture that encourages personal and professional growth, knowledge, and community involvement.
  
As a not-for-profit, WoodmenLife is a different kind of insurance company. We give back revenues to our members, not investors. We’ve been around for more than a century because we’ve always kept our promises. Through recessions and wars, we’ve remained stable and reliable.
  
If you want to be part of an organization where you’re not just an employee – you’re a valued member of the family – WoodmenLife is the place for you!
  
Quote from current associate about why they love this position:
  
“As a data architect for WoodmenLife, you get to work with an amazing team and for a great company. Data is at the heart of all the ongoing projects and initiatives so there are opportunities to be involved in work from all areas of the company. As a data architect you get to use your problem solving and design abilities to help shape the future at WoodmenLife.”
  
  

**Quote from the Manager about why they love this position:**  

“Do you like to produce data models that make a difference? Do you enjoy gaining the understanding of how data relates to the business processes and enhancing that knowledge through your modeling skills? This is the job for you. You will be in the middle of growing this enterprise knowledge with a fun energetic team. WoodmenLife needs you!”
  
  

**POSITION PURPOSE:**  

The Data Architect focuses on the efforts to build a cohesive enterprise data strategy, evangelizing data’s potential and building the organizations analytical skills. Delivers data architecture designs on assigned projects and initiatives.
  
  

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**  

* Acts as the Data Architect for assigned company initiatives. Organizes the database development effort and acts as the senior technical data resource on complex and critical projects.
* Understands the information needs of the enterprise with emphasis on executive information consumption and data that comes from or is provided to parties external to the enterprise.
* Participates as a member of the Enterprise Architecture Board, which helps develop the long-term vision of how to apply Data decisions that supports the organization’s strategy and leads initiatives that implements the appropriate Data technology.
* May work on more than one enterprise project in support of another architect, engaged up to 50% capacity performing execution activities.
* Oversees, directs, and/or provides consultation on database implementations and improvement activities for projects or high impact work activities.
* Leverages internal and external data sources to enhance the consumer experience and create additional opportunities for sales.
* Collaborates with Solution Architects on architectural decisions to ensure solutions are designed for successful implementation within the vision of the enterprise architecture.
* Assists in technical discussions with vendors and provides input regarding Data storage, consistency and integrity considerations of the system.
* Ensures team follows defined Data security and Data integrity processes throughout product lifecycle to achieve delivery dates on time with quality.
* Ensures adoption of standards in use by engineers and developers to promote repeatable successful projects.
* Educates upward and outward about the business value of enterprise data architecture and data management.
* Analyzes business context (trends and business strategy), as well as change requirements in other architecture viewpoints and integration architecture to derive the Data architecture future state.
* Directs, coaches and mentors staff to ensure engagement and productivity levels are maintained; sets clear objectives and compares deliverables against objectives.
* Performs other duties as assigned by management.


Minimum Qualifications
  
  

This job requires a background that demonstrates the following minimum knowledge, skills, talents and traits:
  
* Bachelor’s degree or at least six years’ experience in a multiple vendor RDBMS environment.
* Four or more years’ experience in a technical (hands-on) database, data warehouse or data engineering leadership role; ability to lead, motivate, and develop a group of professionals capable of achieving aggressive business goals and objectives.
* Data modeling and information classification expertise at the enterprise level.
* Solid understanding of Service-Oriented Architecture and the processes of mapping, managing, and moving data through different logical layers of architecture.
* Familiarity with Master Data Management (MDM), business intelligence, and data warehouse development techniques.
* High level of Data Security awareness.
* Understanding of the differences between relational and object modeling.
* Knowledge of modeling practices and tools such as mind-mapping, UML, ERWIN diagrams and others.
* Ability to motivate and gain acceptance for your ideas.
* Experience working with Portfolio Project Management Office (PPMO) to establish realistic delivery estimates.
* Detailed knowledge of current technologies and developments in the software & systems engineering industry.
* Strong communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills are a must as is the ability to embrace change in a positive and enthusiastic manner.
* Ability to define problems, establishes facts, draw valid conclusions and be able to manage multiple project deadlines.
* Ability to provide seamless, trustworthy, attentive and resourceful (S.T.A.R.) customer service.
* Ability to engage well with others and passionate about providing an exemplary customer experience.
* Meets expectations for attendance and punctuality in accordance with the expectations established by supervisor and WoodmenLife policy.


Desired Qualifications
  
* Knowledge of the insurance/financial services industry.
* Microsoft SQL Server Certified.
* Broad multi-platform, multi-technology development experience.
* Prior job experience as a data warehouse programmer/manager, database administrator or data architect is a plus.


WoodmenLife offers a competitive compensation package and a comprehensive benefits package (https://www.woodmenlife.org/careers/home-office/benefits/). As part of WoodmenLife’s employment process, candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check, credit check (where required for position), Fingerprint check (where required for position), drug screen and reference checks. Any offer of employment will be contingent upon successfully passing the above.
  
WoodmenLife is committed to excellence in diversity by creating an inclusive work environment that values and respects all individuals. We welcome and embrace associates, regardless of background and beliefs. WoodmenLife respects every associate’s unique perspective and contribution. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment that values differences, and creates opportunities for growth, leadership and service. This commitment includes providing equal opportunity in recruitment, employment and promotion, training and community outreach. WoodmenLife is also dedicated to strengthening the communities in which its employees live.
  
APPLICANTS WITH DISABILITIES SHOULD ADVISE THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT AT THE TIME OF APPLICATION IF SPECIAL ACCOMMODATIONS ARE NEEDED.
  
Woodmen of the World Life Insurance Society (WoodmenLife) is an equal opportunity employer.

title: VP, Consulting - Virtual
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.
  
Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:
  
* Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA
* Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world
* Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY
* Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe


Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
  
  

What part will you play?
  
Diversified continues to expand our thought leadership team to grow our Consulting practice further, encompassing a larger focus across our company’s business units of Media and Workplace with the addition of a Vice President of Consulting.
  
We are seeking a Vice President of Consulting, to spearhead our Consulting practice across Media and Workplace verticals. This executive role is pivotal in leading a team of consultants and subject matter experts, driving excellence in thought leadership, customer service, and business acumen. The Vice President, Consulting, will be instrumental in shaping the strategic direction of the consulting division, ensuring the delivery of high-value, outcome focused solutions to our clients, and fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration.
  
The Consulting team is staffed with, among other roles, Principal Consultants across multiple disciplines inclusive of transformation efforts, Media supply chain initiatives, and Experiential Workplace solutions. These consultants serve as lead advisors for key/enterprise clients and strategic projects. The VP of Consulting is responsible, at an executive level, for the overarching deliverables supporting the decisions and recommendations made within the team, inclusive of the team itself and their activities.
  
What will you be doing?
  
* The VP of Consulting is a senior leadr within the Consulting staff and offers top down expertise, resources, and guidance to help our clients succeed in their industry. As a VP of Consulting, you may specialize in a variety of technologies/practice areas, and your duties include:
* Provide visionary leadership for the Consulting practice, setting strategic goals and driving business growth across Media and Workplace sectors.
* Lead, mentor, and expand a team of consultants and subject matter experts, fostering an environment of professional development and excellence.
* Oversee the sales process, from lead generation to deal closure, ensuring a high standard of customer service and satisfaction.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key clients and business partners, understanding their business needs and delivering tailored consulting solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the integration of consulting services with One Diversified's broader offerings.
* Drive thought leadership in the industry, representing the company at conferences, panels, and networking events.
* Ensure the consulting practice's offerings remain at the forefront of industry trends and technological advancements.
* Report to the Senior Vice President of Consulting, providing regular updates on practice performance, market opportunities, and strategic initiatives.


You should expect to work, both in a leadership and supporting function, on several projects across multiple clients as you immerse yourself in their business imperatives and processes, advise on business strategy and tactics, and provide vision and direction for the team.
  
You are responsible for the leadership and ultimate execution of the engagement deliverables, which will follow Diversified’s highest standards for quality and presentation with C-Level caliber collateral.
  
Ideally, You will maintain a subject matter expert role versed in a variety of technologies, including intimate knowledge of vendor product offerings, and a firm perspective on the competitive landscape. Additionally, you will serve as an industry evangelist representing Diversified at global technology conferences, customer engagements and publications in both print and online.
  
  

**Other duties will include:**  

* Develop deep working relationships with Senior Executives and Senior Managers across the client account teams.
* Understand the business direction of clients, Building knowledge capital through research and development, leveraging industry insights to deliver best of breed solutions to clients.
* Helping grow consulting Globally through thought leadership and entrepreneurialism.
* Function as the main contact between Diversified and client from beginning to end of a project/engagement ensuring the team meets the client's needs.
* Develop relationships throughout the customer's organization to identify new business opportunities.
* Participate with Sales during the sales process through scoping workshops, presentations, solutions, development of SOW's.
* Provide the bridge between Sales and Professional Services as new opportunities are closed.
* Create an environment where others feel it is safe to be open and candid, and where conflicting ideas and opinions are regularly discussed.
* Participate in projects involving strategy, implementation support, and optimization related to digital solutions media supply chain.
* Responsible to collaborate on the creation of project deliverables inclusive of the recommendations of technology, Bills of Materials, design concepts and deployment strategies, and quoting and support in vendor negotiations


**Complexity:**  

Highly Complex; The Principal Consultant needs to be able to assimilate complex areas of technology to conceptualize and communicate these to customers at the highest level.
  
  

**Decision Making Authority:**  

The Principal Consultant role reports to the Head of the Consulting department and will direct teams of other consultants, solutions architects along with vendors and customers throughout an engagement lifecycle. They will work with the Diversified account executives to make informed business decisions that will benefit the customer’s desired outcome.
  
  

**Physical Working Environment:**  

Limited physical labor required; most work will be performed on a computer. Remote or On-Site. Up to 50% travel may be expected.
  
What do we require from you?
  
  

**Education/Certifications:**  

* 4-year degree in a relevant business / technology field of study or equivalent experience.
* Experienced with technology and business operations and strategies relevant to the production, processing and distribution of audiovisual content for a variety of industries, including media, financial, retail, etc.


**Required/Desired Knowledge, Experience and Skills:**  

* You are an undisputed expert in your field(s) of technology and business, with 10+ years of experience as a solutions architect/engineer and trusted customer advisor.
* Your educational and professional background is varied and multifaceted and has equipped you with a broad perspective on business and technology, rooted in practical work as an engineer, solution sales professional, or other customer-facing roles.
* You are skilled at problem-solving, identifying issues, and conceptualizing solutions and you’re able to articulate a clear roadmap for implementing those solutions.
* As a Principal Consultant, you may be responsible for multiple projects at the same time, so it is necessary to have strong organizational skills that enable you to manage your time and responsibilities effectively and efficiently. Your organizational skills will also be required to keep track of client information, project details and other important data.
* You are able to manage time to plan and execute tasks effectively and efficiently within a set time frame for yourself and others to manage your own workload and that of your team members, ensuring that tasks are completed on time.
* You are trained, certified or deeply experienced in working with many of the following platforms: Platforms for compute, storage, orchestration and media processing, including AWS, Azure, Google, SAN/NAS, Object Storage (cloud/remote/on-premises), transcoding (Vantage, Elemental), MAMs (Iconik, CatDV, Dalet Flex, Vidispine, Avid MediaCentral/Interplay), Editorial, (Avid, Adobe, Apple, DaVinci), Cloud/hybrid Workflow, Remote workflow (Teradici, BeBop, etc.) and Virtualization Platforms (VMWare ESXi), as well as other media-related systems and solutions
* You have an in-depth understanding of media production, processing and distribution workflows for both live and fille-based content.
* You have excellent communication skills to both listen, understand, and convey important and complex technical information to clients, other consultants and other professionals.
* You are able to communicate effectively with vendors and manufacturers about RFQ technology, pricing and terms.
* You are a highly self-motivated self-starter who can operate independently as well as collaboratively with other Diversified team members to multi-task in an energetic environment.
* Must have the ability to communicate confidently with customers on a 1-on-1 and group setting.
* Must be willing to travel and able to work in a light industrial environment.
* Demonstrated ability to carry out consulting activities, methodologies leading to comprehensive discovery, analysis and technical/business recommendations.
* Advanced communication skills, including business/technical writing and presentations.
* Advanced ability to present in-depth technical solutions
* Self-motivation with the ability to motivate and energize a project team
* Demonstrate ability to work successfully at all customer levels from C-level executives to end users
* Thoughtful leadership and innovative thinking.


To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.
  
  

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at careers@onediversified.com.

title: Services PreSales Architect
description:
**Get to know Okta**

  

Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.

**The Services PreSales Architect Opportunity**



Reporting to the Director, Services PreSales Architecture, this role will is a technical authority on both cloud and on-premises based IAM systems and is responsible for ensuring the successful design and implementation of Okta's industry leading cloud identity platform for our customers. You will focus on Okta's workforce and customer identity offerings. You will develop relationships with customers to help them achieve their business goals while promoting creative solutions. You will establish yourself as a trusted partner with your customers with a focus on their success. You will translate business needs and insights into an actionable strategy that the delivery team can use to assist customers in driving their initiatives to results and high business value. This is a key member of the Professional Services (PS) Go-to-Market (GTM) team.


**What you'll be doing**


* Lead the pre-sales discovery of business, functional and technical requirements required to establish an Identity platform powered by Okta for our customers.
* Work with customers and services sales team to document and mitigate technical risk identified during discovery.
* Support creation of services estimates to implement the proposed solution.
* Review services estimates to ensure project scope can be successfully delivered as outlined - technical risk is appropriately mitigated and timelines follow staffing guidelines.


**Minimum REQUIRED Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**


* 7+ years of overall IT / software development experience, solution design and technical architecture experience
* 3+ years of Okta implementation experience
* 5+ years of consulting experience
* 5+ years driving application architecture design
* 5+ years of experience with (IAM) architectures
* 5+ years implementing cloud computing solutions including AWS, Google Apps, Salesforce etc
* Experience with employee and customer identity use cases: HR driven identity, Active Directory, SSO, SaaS application integrations
* Experience with Identity Governance and Privileged Access Management use cases
* Demonstrated ability to work and interact with CxOs and high-level customer executives
* Led discovery workshops to derive customer requirements, specifications, business processes
* Developed functional specifications and system design specifications for customer engagements
* Strong knowledge of Security Architecture, Design and Operations, LDAP, Active Directory, SSO, SAML, OIDC, RBAC, OAuth, JSON, REST
* Experience integrating with a multitude of On-Prem and SaaS based products
* Exhibits confidence and a deep understanding of emerging industry practices when solving business problems
* Identifies critical issues with ease
* Effectively communicates technical information to non-technical audiences
* Manages customer expectations effectively
* Application design experience
* Clear and Dynamic Communication
* Ability to travel up to 50%


**Highly Desirable Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**


* Knowledge of software development security and cryptography
* Familiarity with IAM solution providers
* Experience with API Gateways, CASB, and Reverse Proxies (NGINX)
* Knowledge of cloud/virtualization technologies, such as VMware vSphere, EC2, Xen, KVM, OpenStack
* Various open-source software and development tools
* Proficiency in one or more of .Net, Ruby, Java, Python or Perl
* git and Subversion


**Certification**


* Okta Certified Technical Architect or a combination of Okta Certified Consultant and Okta Certified Developer is a plus
* CISSP certification is a plus
* TOGAF certification is a plus


#LI-Remote



#LI-BF1

**The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in the San Francisco Bay area is between:**

$196,000—$294,000 USD
Below is the annual base salary range for candidates located in California, Colorado, New York and Washington. Your actual base salary will depend on factors such as your skills, qualifications, experience, and work location. In addition, Okta offers equity (where applicable), bonus, and benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), flexible spending account, and paid leave (including PTO and parental leave) in accordance with our applicable plans and policies. To learn more about our Total Rewards program please visit: https://rewards.okta.com/us.

 **The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in California (excluding San Francisco Bay Area), Colorado, New York, and Washington is between:**


$175,000—$263,000 USD**What you can look forward to as an Okta employee!**


* Amazing Benefits
* Making Social Impact
* Fostering Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging at Okta


Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.



Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and convictions records, consistent with applicable laws. title: Principal SAP Solution Architect
description:
**Principal SAP Solution Architect**


**Company Overview:**  

Argano stands as a leading global digital consultancy, merging strategic insight with execution prowess to catalyze transformation in business operations. Our mission is to boost our clients' agility, profitability, customer engagement, and growth. Through strategic consulting backed by proprietary IP, Argano offers a holistic assessment of business operations, identifying strengths and pinpointing opportunities for improvement. Our worldwide network of industry veterans leads the charge in operational design and technological advancements across various applications, including comprehensive SAP solutions, positioning our clients at the vanguard of digital transformation.


**Role Overview:**  

As the Principal SAP Solution Architect at Argano, you will be the cornerstone of our SAP practice, steering SAP-enabled business transformations. Your mandate is to architect our SAP solution, strategy, delivering unparalleled value through futuristic SAP solutions, and affirming Argano’s status as the definitive partner for SAP digital transformation projects.


**Key Responsibilities:**


**Requirements Management & Analysis:**


* Master the art of requirements management and analysis to significantly advance business objectives.
* Expertly identify and document essential emerging business requirements, challenging business partner preferences to uncover unique value propositions.
* Forge consensus around a future state that resolves business challenges and aligns with enterprise goals, adeptly translating business requirements into SAP solution functionalities.
* Possess a deep comprehension of business process intricacies and the acumen to reveal needs that business partners and end users may not articulate.
* Influence business partner requirements towards enterprise objectives and align with industry domain and standards.


**Creating Compelling Business Cases:**


* Develop and articulate persuasive business cases, quantifying the benefits of proposed projects.
* Maintain awareness of industry-specific trends and their implications for the organization, articulating benefits in a manner that resonates with business leaders.
* Measure the business value contribution of IT projects accurately, swiftly adjusting to shifts in business strategy.
* Support business partners in presenting solution value to key stakeholders effectively.


**Provide Accurate Project Effort Estimates:**


* Precisely quantify project resource needs, adeptly managing ambiguity to produce accurate project effort estimates and communicating risks throughout the lifecycle.
* Actively engage project stakeholders in the estimation process, mindful of the impact of strategic business changes.


**Architecture Management:**


* Champion architectural goals through innovative solution design, identifying commonalities to recommend a cohesive approach across projects when standards are lacking.
* Influence solution options, desired value proposition and decision-making among business partners, pinpointing opportunities for creating reusable enterprise services.
* Navigate technology vendor interactions with an eye towards architectural coherence.


**Business Relationship Management:**


* Foster and enrich relationships with business sponsors, aligning technological solutions with targeted business outcomes and adeptly managing expectations amid scope changes.
* Skillfully mediate conflicts between multiple business partners, prioritizing organizational goals.


**Technical Implementation & Maintenance:**


* Oversee the software development lifecycle for implementing and maintaining SAP solutions, leading small teams and projects from start to finish.
* Architect, develop, test, and deploy SAP application software modifications to meet business needs, consistently adhering to industry best practices.
* Ensure system support aligns with SLAs, resolving issues as they arise.
* Apply enhancements/changes after rigorous QA testing, following standard change control practices to maintain production stability.
* Monitor service changes like upgrades or enhancements to prevent negative impacts on system customizations.
* Oversee interface updates, ensuring accuracy and operational efficiency.


**This position offers a unique opportunity to significantly influence our clients' success and bolster Argano’s growth as a leader in digital consultancy. If you are endowed with profound SAP expertise, a zeal for digital transformation, and a history of impactful achievements, we invite you to join our dynamic team at Argano.**


**Requirements:**


* BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or a Business Degree with a strong emphasis on digital technology.
* At least 10+ years of extensive experience in SAP consulting with a thorough understanding of its modules and functionalities, with at least 5 years as an overall solution architect.
* A proven track record of leadership at the executive level.
* Deep knowledge of SAP ecosystems, adept at crafting digital transformation strategies and optimizing business processes.
* Exceptional analytical, communication, and negotiation skills, capable of operating independently in complex environments while fostering a spirit of collaboration.
* Self-motivated, with a proactive approach and hands-on leadership style.


The base compensation range for this position is $170,000 - $200,000 commensurate with experience. Argano also offers a performance-based bonus and strong benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Parental Leave and Flexible Time Off.

title: AWS Cloud Data Architect
description:
**JOB DETAILS:**

**Job Title: AWS CLOUD DATA ARCHITECT**

**Location: Remote** 

**Duration: 5 years**

**Required Skills: Architect, AWS, Data**

**Note: Looking for candidates with Public Trust Clearance.**

**Job Description:**

**AWS Cloud Data Architect**

* Leads the design and implementation of an AWS big data solution which could include data warehousing and/or data lake approaches.
* Recommends and designs innovative data solutions using AWS cloud-native services.
* Guides the applications teams to adapt their application architectures to leverage AWS Data Analysis services such as Redshift and Quick Sight, AWS Storage services such as S3 and RDS, and AWS Event/Data Processing Services such as Lambda, Glue, and Sage Maker.

**Certifications Required:** AWS practitioner or solutions architect certification or relevant AWS data certifications.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: GCP Data Architect
description:
**Data Architect**  
**Preferably Dallas, TX and remote is ok anywhere in USA**

**They are now looking for GCP data experience.**

· Minimum 6 years in a Data Architect role supporting warehouse and big data platforms/environments.

· Minimum 2 years’ experience working in Sr Data Architect role including with Cloud data platforms.

· Highly experienced in understanding data relationships and with strong data exploration skills using SQL.

· Deep understanding of data flows, data taxonomy and organization, data lineage, data virtualization.

· Strong Data Management and Data Governance knowledge and implementation experience.

· Experience with implementing data security frameworks and enterprise data architecture best practices.

· Experience creating high level and detailed data architecture & design documentation.

· Business Analyst mindset/aptitude to understand domain data requirements for design deliverables.

· Data Warehouse Data Modeling using Erwin - Data Flow, ER Diagram, Conceptual, Logical and Physical.

· Experience with architecting end to end data solutions for both batch and real time designs.

· Metadata & documentation management required for Erwin modelling, data cataloging.

· Strong data design experience & knowledge that can be applied to big data architectures and cloud data lake environments, (ie Very strong data analysis & design experience on Teradata and GCP platforms for curation and analytics use cases).

· Experience working collaboratively with clients, developers, and architecture teams understanding requirements to design and implement enterprise level data solutions.

· **GCP Cloud data (including BigQuery) experience is required.**

· **Teradata implementation experience is strongly preferred.**

· Experience with Data Fabric and Data Mesh architecture is preferred.

· Experience with Starburst (data virtualization) & IBM Cloud Pak (data governance) is preferred.

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills is a must.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $70.00 - $75.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Python Backend Engineer
description:
We are looking for exceedingly passionate, capable, and hardworking individuals who want to help shape the future of our industry. If you are looking for an environment that fosters “work-life balance” or is more of a standard “clock-in and clock-out” role, please do not apply.

**About Us:** 

We are seeking a talented and experienced **Senior Python Backend Engineer** to join our team. We’re a trailblazing A.I. Communications company, searching for an individual who can lead the charge in AI / ML solutions that make an impact.

**Role and Responsibilities:** 

We are seeking a Senior Python Backend Engineer to join our team at Belva. As a Python Developer, you will work with our back-end engineers and AI/ML engineers to help build products.

You will play a central role in designing and developing our products. The ideal candidate should have at least 5 years of experience as a backend Python developer in production environments. You must have a solid understanding of how Python deployments are managed and understand virtual environments. You will be working as a part of a highly experienced and fast-moving team of passionate product builders.

**Duties / Responsibilities:** 

* Collaborate with our AI/ML and back-end team to integrate models and data pipelines into software applications.
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable backend systems that leverage technologies such as transformers, vector databases, and other relevant tools.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to define requirements, architect solutions, and implement features that enhance the performance and functionality of our products.
* Lead the development and deployment of backend components, ensuring code quality, performance, and maintainability.
* Mentor and provide technical guidance to junior developers, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous learning.
* Participate in code reviews, providing valuable feedback to ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices.
* Collaborate with DevOps to optimize infrastructure and ensure smooth deployment and monitoring of backend services.
* Troubleshoot and resolve backend-related issues, addressing performance bottlenecks, bugs, and other challenges as they arise.
* Contribute to the growth and mentorship of junior developers and potentially lead project teams.

**Required Skills/Abilities:** 

* Minimum of 5 years of professional experience as a backend Python Developer in production environments.
* Solid understanding of Python deployment best practices, including dependency management, virtual environments, containerization, etc.
* Strong experience in designing and developing backend systems, API design, and microservice architectures.
* Familiarity with AWS services like EC2 and S3 and the ability to architect scalable Python solutions on the AWS platform is a plus.
* Solid knowledge of continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices and the ability to set up and manage automated deployment pipelines.
* Proven track record of delivering high-quality, production-grade software solutions in a fast moving team environment.
* Work with other teams (i.e. PM, etc.) to ensure delivered code meets specifications based on functional/technical specifications.
* Create unit and integration tests to fully test and regress software. Break down complex requirements into independent coding tasks and strategies.

**Qualifications and Experience:** 

* Must be a Citizen or Green Card Holder and live in the United States
* 5+ years of professional experience as a backend Python Developer.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to tackle complex challenges.
* Prior experience in leadership or mentorship roles is a plus.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Openness to new ideas and an unceasing desire to learn new things.

**Preferred Qualifications:** 

* Previous experience working with AI/ML teams or on AI-driven projects is a plus but not required.
* Experience with database systems such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB.
* Experience with orchestration tools such as Kubernetes is desirable.
* Experience with Atlassian tools: JIRA, Confluence, etc.
* Familiarity with AWS services like EC2 and S3 and the ability to architect scalable Python solutions.

**Why Join Us:** 

* Cutting-edge Technology: Become a key player in a pioneering A.I. Communications company that is an upcoming industry leader.
* Meaningful Impact: Contribute to the creation of accessible and flexible A.I. Communications solutions that empower customers and businesses.
* Professional Growth: Challenging projects that expand your skill set, foster continuous learning, and elevate your career trajectory.

We eagerly anticipate the chance to discuss how your expertise can contribute to our team's success and make a lasting difference. We look forward to the possibility of working together.

**Experience level:** 

* 5 years

**Schedule:** 

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Remote role

**Experience:** 

* Python: 5 years (Required)
* Software development: 5 years (Required)

**Work Location:** Remote (Company HQ in Bellevue, WA.)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $144,482.00 - $156,775.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Databricks Infrastructure Engineer
description:
LightFeather is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced **Databricks Infrastructure Engineer** to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, deploying, and managing robust, scalable, and secure Databricks infrastructure to support our enterprise-scale applications. This role is pivotal in managing, processing, and funneling large datasets from multiple sources into a centralized data lake, ensuring seamless access, integration, and efficient data processing capabilities.

**This Position is Remote.**

**Position Type: Part-Time**  

**Contract Type: 1099**

**Responsibilities:**

* Design and implement scalable and secure Databricks infrastructure on Amazon AWS, ensuring high availability and performance for enterprise applications.
* Architect and manage data pipelines, employing ETL processes for data aggregation, analysis, and ensuring seamless integration with the data lake.
* Leverage Terraform for infrastructure as code (IaC) practices to automate and manage infrastructure provisioning and scaling.
* Develop and maintain Python Notebooks within Databricks for data analysis and processing, optimizing data workflows for efficiency and accuracy.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs, ensuring best practices are followed in data management and infrastructure scaling.
* Stay abreast of the latest industry trends in data engineering, contributing to continuous improvement and innovation within the team.

**Qualifications:**

* US Citizenship
* DHS Public Trust EOD eligible.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in designing and deploying Databricks infrastructure on cloud platforms, preferably Amazon AWS.
* Deep understanding of Apache Spark, Delta Lake, and their integration within the Databricks environment.
* Proficient in Terraform for implementing infrastructure as code (IaC) solutions.
* Strong expertise in Python, especially in developing Notebooks for data analysis within Databricks.
* Demonstrated ability to design and implement complex data pipelines with ETL processes for large-scale data aggregation and analysis.
* Knowledge of best practices for infrastructure scaling and data management, with a keen focus on security and robustness.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

**Why Join LightFeather?**  

You'll be part of a team dedicated to meaningful impact, working on solutions that address mission-critical needs. Experience variety, fulfillment, and the opportunity to work with some of the best in the industry. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone is valued and respected.

**Commitment to Diversity**  

LightFeather is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: Microsoft 365 Architect
description:
**Microsoft 365 A****rchitect**


**Job Overview**


Inviso is looking for a subject matter expert in Security, Compliance, Identity, and Enterprise device management under the Microsoft 365 umbrella. This candidate would join our Infrastructure and Security team to lead our end customers through modernization of endpoints and embracing Microsoft’s Zero Trust security model. This position will focus on designing, implementing, maintaining, and supporting security and compliance solutions leveraging Microsoft tooling. We are looking for a strong customer-facing solution architect with deep expertise in the Microsoft 365 security stack.


This position will work remotely and be available to work hours in support of the North America time zones.


**Responsibilities**


* Draft proposed solutions/implementations for various customer scenarios that leverage advanced features of the latest Microsoft Security offerings to strengthen security posture.
* Develop repeatable deployment plans for Microsoft Security, Compliance & Identity offerings.
* Create reusable processes and materials to guide initial assessment of customer environments. This may include questionnaires, checklists, or sample commentary to use during initial customer calls and workshops.
* Oversee the implementation of provided solutions by onshore, nearshore, and offshore engineering teams.
* Build proofs of concept and sample environments to demonstrate Microsoft 365 offerings.
* Function as the technical product owner of the Microsoft 365 Security & Infrastructure offerings for our practice.
* Perform configuration and management of Windows-based corporate systems and personal mobile devices via Microsoft Intune on customer environments.
* Configuration and management of Microsoft Autopilot to set up and pre-configure new devices, getting them ready for productive use.
* Build and maintain automation to manage the on prem and cloud infrastructure related to Microsoft 365, Entra ID, and Active Directory.
* Configuration and deployment of Azure Virtual Desktop and/or Windows 365.
* Configure and monitor cloud infrastructure (including Intune, Autopilot, Azure Virtual Desktop, etc.)
* Troubleshoot and repair complex technical problems with team members, customers, and vendors quickly and effectively.
* Research competing third party products to identify feature parity with Microsoft Security, Compliance & Identity offerings.


**Qualifications**


* Background in Professional Services / Consulting delivery.
* Can demonstrate 5+ years’ experience with all aspects of solution design, implementation, maintenance, and support of one or more of the following Microsoft Security, Compliance & Identity products: Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Defender, Entra ID Premium (Risk Based Conditional Access, PIM, MFA), Windows Hello for Business.
* Can demonstrate experience with solution design, implementation, maintenance and support of Windows 365 and Azure Virtual Desktop
* Minimum of 5 years’ experience working in an Enterprise IT environment.
* A trusted Technical Advisor to customers and internal team. Ability to share knowledge and strengthen our team.
* Ability to work independently, as part of a team or in a lead role.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to work effectively on multiple priorities with firm delivery dates.
* Effective communication skills within information technology and business environments.
* Customer and quality focused individual.
* Proven record of guiding customers through the Modern Workplace journey, providing recommended best practices and driving execution.
* System/Program Specific Experience:
	+ Firm understanding of the Microsoft 365 security and identity components.
	+ Experience within a large-scale Windows Enterprise customer/employer.
	+ Solid understanding of Hybrid Azure Active Directory and Active Directory Federation Services.
	+ Experience with PowerShell, PowerShell Workflow and troubleshooting PowerShell ISE
	+ Identity Management (Active Directory, EntraID, Microsoft Identity Manager/FIM).
	+ Windows Hello for Business.

**About Inviso:** *Inviso is a premier consulting firm that delivers business solutions through Solution Assessment, Azure Infrastructure, Modern Work & Security, Data & Analytics, Business Process Automation, Cloud Cost & License Optimization, Staffing, and Marketing. We are an entrepreneurial, agile organization with a broad range of business experience and talents, and a laser focus on adding value for our customers. With headquarters in Seattle, and additional locations around the world, we assist thousands of customers across the globe.*

title: Microsoft Solutions Architect
description:
**Job Description:**  
We are currently seeking a highly experienced Microsoft Domain Migration Consultant to join our team on a short-term basis. The ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting a thorough discovery assessment of our current Microsoft domain environment, identifying all necessary requirements for a successful migration. This role requires a strategic thinker with extensive knowledge in Microsoft domain architectures and migration strategies.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct a comprehensive discovery assessment of the current Microsoft domain setup, including all associated systems, applications, and data.
* Identify potential challenges, risks, and dependencies associated with the migration process.
* Develop a detailed migration strategy and playbook, outlining step-by-step processes, timelines, resource requirements, and best practices.
* Provide high-level architectural guidance and recommendations to ensure a seamless and efficient migration process.
* Collaborate closely with IT teams to ensure understanding and alignment with the migration strategy.
* Offer expert advice on mitigating risks and addressing potential issues during the migration.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards throughout the migration process.
* Deliver regular progress reports and updates to senior management and stakeholders.

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience as a Microsoft Domain Migration Consultant or similar role, with a strong portfolio of successful domain migration projects.
* Deep knowledge of Microsoft domain architectures, Active Directory, and related technologies.
* Expertise in migration tools and methodologies specific to Microsoft environments.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to conduct detailed technical assessments and develop effective migration strategies.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
* Familiarity with regulatory standards and compliance requirements related to data protection and migration.
* Professional certifications in Microsoft technologies (e.g., MCSE, MCSA) are highly desirable.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $66.16 - $79.68 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Application Question(s):

* How many years of experienced do you have as a Microsoft Solutions Architect?

Work Location: Remote

title: Cloud Solution Architect - Platform Operations Lead
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

***This role is based remotely but if you live within a 50-mile radius of Warren, MI, you are expected to report to that location three times a week, at minimum***

**The Role:**

General Motors is a forward-thinking organization dedicated to harnessing the power of data to drive business growth and innovation. We are looking for an accomplished Lead Architect with a strong background in creating data assets, developing data products, and a robust release management practice that allows GM to implement machine learning models. As a pivotal member of our technology leadership team, you will play a key role in shaping our data architecture strategy and ensuring the successful delivery of insights that contribute to the organization's financial success.


This role focuses on the day to day Operations of the GM "Insight Factory" - including End to End health of the data ecosystem.


**What You'll Do:**  



**Data Architecture and Strategy:**

* Lead the development and execution of the overall data architecture strategy. (Azure based with Databricks at this time)
* Design and implement robust data assets, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
* Add functionality/expand the limits of functionality of GitHub Enterprise, GitHub Actions, Git Flow (including CoPilot)
* Build additional functionality into the existing CICD to produce reliable release artifacts that allow us to control the quality of code in our environment.
* Work closely with the Operations Lead to implement APM that allows for the creation and monitoring of “End to End” timing charts – every step and no step missed.
Work with Infra Leads to implement deployment isolation and release best practices to ensure smooth, frequent releases with appropriate rollback.  
* 

  

**Data Product and ML Model and Application Development:**

* Oversee the creation of data products that leverage the organization's data assets.
* Lead the development and deployment of machine learning models that enhance decision-making processes
* Leverage our existing stack – including ML Flow - to implement ML Ops and create a model registry.
Develop approach to support Dev,Test,PreProd and Prod environment release process.  
* 

  

**Integration with Dashboards and Applications:**

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data assets, data products, and ML models into dashboards and applications.
Ensure seamless interaction between data components and front-end applications.  
* 

  

**Insight Generation and Monetization:**

* Play a pivotal role in generating actionable insights from data products and ML models.
Work closely with business stakeholders to identify opportunities for monetizing data assets and insights.  
* 

  

**Hands-on Leadership:**

* Be hands-on with the creation and implementation of data assets, data products, and ML models.
Mentor and guide a team of skilled professionals in adopting best practices and achieving project goals.  
* 

  

**Continuous Innovation:**

* Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies in data architecture, machine learning, and analytics.
* Drive continuous innovation in the development of data assets and ML models.

**Your Skills & Abilities (Required Qualifications):**

* Proven experience as a Lead Architect with a focus on creating data assets, developing data products, and implementing ML models.
* 1.5 years of operating experience with Cloud Based Production AI/ML/Data Systems.
* Proven ability to create an end to end Threat Analysis with a Threat Modeling tool.
* Experience in creating key rotation automation.
* Experience running the security perimeter of Azure app services or equivalent.
* Ability to create complete Architecture Diagrams in Lucid or Visio - for review by Enterprise Architecture Review Board.
* Experience creating end to end Data Flow Diagrams.
* Experience with running various caching approaches to achieve sub 200MS response times.
* Direct experience instrumenting "every hop" in a data ecosystem via Healthcheck heartbeat monitors that are API ready and can be rolled up into a single pane of glass health dashboard.
* Requirements/Tools: Azure, Databricks, CICD, APM, Hands on keyboard capability - Python preferred
* Strong understanding of data architecture principles, including data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
* Experience with machine learning frameworks and tools, with a track record of successful model development and deployment.
* Proficiency in integrating data assets with dashboards and applications to deliver actionable insights.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Demonstrated success in driving projects that contribute to organizational revenue.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science , Information Technology, or a related field; Advanced degree or relevant certifications in data architecture, machine learning, or related areas is highly desirable.

**Additional Job Description**
------------------------------

**GM DOES NOT PROVIDE IMMIGRATION-RELATED SPONSORSHIP FOR THIS ROLE. DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS ROLE IF YOU WILL NEED GM IMMIGRATION SPONSORSHIP (e.g., H-1B, TN, STEM OPT, etc.) NOW OR IN THE FUTURE.**

**About GM**
------------

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.


**Why Join Us**
---------------

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.


**Benefits Overview**
---------------------

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
  

* Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
* Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
* Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
* Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
* Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
* Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.
**Diversity Information**
-------------------------

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  



  

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.


**Equal Employment Opportunity Statements**
-------------------------------------------

GM is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. GM is committed to providing a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and advancing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, all practices and decisions relating to terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment are made without regard to an indivi d ual's protected characteristics. For purposes of this policy, “protected characteristics" include an individual's actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, weight, height, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at Careers.Accommodations@GM.com or call us at 800-865-7580. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

title: Information Security Solution Architect
description:
Headquartered in Canada with locations across the United States and around the globe with a footprint on six continents, Bulletproof, a GLI company has decades of technology, security, and compliance expertise. Bulletproof’s work in the security space has been recognized nationally and globally with Microsoft’s global Security Partner of the Year in 2021 and five Microsoft Canada Impact Award wins from 2019 to present-day.
  
  

At Bulletproof, our vision is to serve, secure, and empower the world through people and technology; one customer at a time. We believe everyone has the right to feel safe and secure. Our mission is to serve and protect organizations to ensure their success.
  
  

**What we have to offer:**  

* Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. Across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they're passionate about.
* Great People - We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
* Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
* Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion - We celebrate each other’s differences, continuously strive for equality, and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.


**Job Details/Essential Functions/Responsibilities:**  

* Assist sales team with pre-sales questions and accompany them to meetings as a technical resource in order to drive Information Security Services InfoSec Services) sales from a technical standpoint.
* Possess a thorough knowledge of industry leading cybersecurity solutions and services.
* Conduct Pre-Sales Webinars to potential customers and partners.
* Conduct Pre-Sales On-Site visits to selected customers.
* Attend and deliver product and art of the possible presentations during seminars, webinars, events, and tradeshows.
* Gather relevant information and scoping information based on client needs.
* Assists with the creation of Statements of Work, Pricing Workbooks, Sales Proposals, and RFP responses.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Required Skills & Education:**  

* 3-5 years experience in an IT security related role with a strong understanding of cybersecurity concepts including security assessments, risk assessments, auditing, and governance, technical security testing such as penetration testing, vulnerability assessments, social engineering, and application security assessments.
* Strong knowledge of and experience with leading security frameworks, guidelines, and standards such as ISO 27001, NIST CSF, CMMC, and NIST 800-53.
* Knowledge of and experience with security red-team and blue-team toolsets including Kali Linux, vulnerability scanners, OWASP, and NIST 800-30.
* Knowledge of and experience with Security Operations Center toolsets including SIEM products is desirable.
* Knowledge of Cloud Security technologies, multi-cloud experience desirable.
* Desired certifications would include CISSP, CEH, or related security certs.


**Attributes/Characteristics:**  

* Strong team player
* Results focused.
* Highly organized, adaptability, flexibility, and the ability to do quality work under tight timelines.
* Expert written and oral communication skills including the ability to communicate with all levels.
* Strong presentation and communication skills.
* Ability to multi-task.


**Travel Expectations:**  

* Local and domestic travel may be required for this position occasionally, pursuant to local travel restrictions.
* Valid driver's license is required.


**Location:** This is an on-site or remote position.
  
**Schedule:** Normal hours are Monday through Friday, 40 hours per week.
  
**Salary range:** $100,000 - $120,000
  
**Travel:** Minimal to no travel is expected for this position.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

* Comprehensive Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Optional Health and Flexible Savings Accounts
* 100% Employer Paid Life and Disability Insurance
* 20 Days Paid Time Off (Per Year)
* 401K Savings Plan with 100% match up to 3% of your salary
* Annual Discretionary Bonus
* Anniversary Reward Bonus
* Educational Assistance Program
* Additional Mental Health Benefits through our Employee Assistance Program
* Voluntary Pet, Accident and Critical Event Insurances


This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The incumbent may be requested to perform other job-related task and responsibilities than those stated above.
  
  

Bulletproof is an Equal Opportunity Employer
  
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.
