title: Dynamics CE Solution Architect
description:
Remote


High performing team members. Challenging projects. A stable and profitable company. And a great place to work! This is what you can expect if you join the Quisitive team. Founded in 2016, Quisitive is a publicly traded, global Microsoft partner specializing in Microsoft platform and complementary technologies, custom solutions, and offerings that drive digital transformation and business value for enterprise customers. Our team of professionals has a long history of successfully delivering award-winning Microsoft solutions, and our culture of continual learning ensures that we remain committed to Microsoft’s long-term strategy. *Quisitive was recently named the 2023 Microsoft US Health and Life Sciences AND Solution Assessments Partner of the Year*.

What do we attribute our award-winning success to? The people we hire, of course! People don’t join the Quisitive team for a job. They come to Quisitive to build a career – to continue their infinite quest to learn; to deliver on the most innovative and exciting work of their lives; and to be part of a high-performing and fun culture. We’ll provide you the tools and leadership that you need to be successful, and let you do what you do best!

It is a very exciting time of growth for our Customer Excellence Business Solutions team and we are currently looking for an experienced Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement Solution Architect. Candidates should have experience in solution development and functional analysis into large-scale enterprise Dynamics 365 architecture with a hands-on approach in designing and leading the implementation of Dynamics 365 products, working with both onshore and offshore development teams. *This is a remote position and can be located anywhere in the United States, however we would prefer Austin, Chicago, Dallas, Denver, Houston, Phoenix, San Antonio or Tampa.*

What will I be doing?
* The Solution Architect will work with customers leading the delivery of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE solutions
* Be a champion/SME (Subject Matter Expert) for both technical and functional solutions across the Microsoft platform, driving the adoption of new features and technology
* Possess strong understanding of Dynamics 365 & Power Platform stack and staying relevant with new features
* Create gap analysis between standard functionality and customer requirements
* Identify and recommend product customizations, enhancements, or workarounds to meet customer requirements. Ensure customizations meet customer requirements
* Working with Project Management team, identify business/project risk and mitigate or communicate with customers as necessary.
* Ensure progress updates are communicated to relevant parties both formally and informally.


What's required?
* In-depth knowledge of all modules of Dynamics 365 CE, including Sales, Marketing/ Customers Insights and Field Services
* Strong implementation experience with Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power Virtual Agents, Power BI, RPA etc.)
* Experience working with offshore development teams
* 7+ years of proven experience in implementing End-To-End Large scale solutions involving Dynamics CE(CRM) in various industries
* Excellent presentation and demonstration skills, ability to influence and ease decision making for customers
* Experience and ability to work with distributed teams and deliver quality solutions

  



We are looking for curious initiative takers to join our team, so if you are passionate about being a leader and working with smart people that are committed to accomplishing great things, then apply today!  


*No agencies or third parties, and we* *are unable to offer visa sponsorships at this time.*

About Quisitive

Built on a foundation of helping organizations drive innovation and business improvements, Quisitive (TSXV: QUIS) is rapidly achieving our vision of becoming the premier, global Microsoft partner as we continue to expand across North America and the world. Through our diversified business model, industry-aligned portfolio of IP solutions and complementary technology expertise, Quisitive harnesses Microsoft’s cloud platform ecosystem to generate transformational impact for enterprise customers to meet their business goals. Quisitive’s portfolio of industry-focused solutions accelerates time to market and addresses business challenges in healthcare, manufacturing, state & local government and performance management.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
What We Need
  
FLEETCOR is currently looking to hire a Solutions Architect within our CORPAY line of business. In this role, you'll be instrumental in sculpting the technological future of our payment solutions. Your mission will encompass the crafting and deployment of robust, scalable, and secure architectures, underpinned by C#/.NET frameworks, Java, and leveraging premier cloud services provided by Azure and AWS. Your expertise will not only enhance our operational capabilities but also ensure our offerings remain at the pinnacle of industry standards.
  
How We Work
  
As a Solutions Architect, you will be expected to work in a remote environment. FLEETCOR will set you up for success by providing:
  
  

* Company-issued equipment
* Monthly home internet stipend


Role Responsibilities
  
  

**The responsibilities of the role will include:**  

* Architect and implementing exemplary, scalable, and resilient solutions utilizing C#/.NET, Java, and cloud technologies from Azure and AWS.
* Promoting and applying event-driven and bus-style architectural paradigms to boost application scalability, performance, and business agility.
* Collaborating closely with cross-disciplinary teams to ensure architectural designs are in lockstep with business objectives and product strategy.
* Providing technical leadership and mentorship to development teams, fostering a culture of excellence in development practices, design patterns, and technology utilization.
* Driving the adoption of Azure DevOps and AWS services to optimize CI/CD pipelines, enhancing deployment efficiency and product quality.
* Undertaking comprehensive technology evaluations, advocating for the integration of novel technologies and tools where beneficial.
* Embedding security considerations deeply into all architectural designs, adhering to stringent industry and regulatory standards.
* Actively participating in code reviews, architectural deliberations, and strategic planning sessions to ensure alignment with technical and business goals.


Qualifications & Skills
  
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related discipline.
* Over 5 years of experience in software architecture and development, with profound expertise in C#/.NET and Java environments.
* Demonstrated proficiency with Azure and AWS cloud services, designing cloud-native and hybrid solutions.
* Deep knowledge of implementing event-driven and bus-style architectures, including understanding of messaging patterns and technologies.
* Experience with TypeScript and modern web development frameworks.
* Familiarity with Azure DevOps, AWS services, and CI/CD best practices.
* Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of transforming complex requirements into scalable technological solutions.
* Strong leadership and communication abilities, adept at mentoring developers and engaging with non-technical stakeholders.
* Background in a product-driven setting, with acute awareness of the impact of architectural decisions on product success.
* A fervent passion for technology, with a commitment to staying abreast of the latest trends and best practices in software architecture.


Benefits & Perks
  
* Medical, Dental & Vision benefits available the 1st month after hire
* Automatic enrollment into our 401k plan (subject to eligibility requirements)
* Virtual fitness classes offered company-wide
* Robust PTO offerings including: major holidays, vacation, sick, personal, & volunteer time
* Employee discounts with major providers (i.e. wireless, gym, car rental, etc.)
* Philanthropic support with both local and national organizations
* Fun culture with company-wide contests and prizes


Our Company & Purpose
  
FLEETCOR is a global leader in business payments, laser focused on developing smarter ways for businesses to pay their expenses. Since 2000, FLEETCOR has developed innovative digital solutions that help businesses better track, manage, and pay their expenses. Today, FLEETCOR is an S&P 500 company with hundreds of thousands of customers using our products in over 100 countries. Companies of all sizes, industries and geographies rely on our product portfolio to manage spending more quickly, efficiently and securely than ever before.
  
**We embrace a culture grounded in five key values:** integrity, collaboration, innovation, execution and people. These values offer you the opportunity to ‘thrive & grow’ through career development, volunteer, community, and wellness initiatives. This allows you to create a balance between professional goals and personal achievement.
  
FLEETCOR is also committed to building and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, equality, and belonging by:
  
* Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;
* Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and
* Valuing each person’s unique perspectives and individual contributions


Embracing diversity enables our people to “make the difference” as FLEETCOR and its more than 8,000 employees continue to shape the future of global payments. Learn more by visiting www.FLEETCOR.com or following FLEETCOR on LinkedIn.
  
Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer
  
FLEETCOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. FLEETCOR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, gender (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, language, ancestry, genetic information, veteran and/or military status or any other group status protected by federal or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process, please notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.
  
For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links:  EEO and Pay Transparency

title: Associate Salesforce Administrator
description:
Location: **Remote**
  

Job Code: **24-026**
  

# of Openings: **3**  


**Description**
===============

  

At Technatomy, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customer’s success. We provide solutions to agencies and entities including Veterans Affairs, Department of Defense, Defense Logistics Agency, and National Institute of Health, and more. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.



 If this sounds like an environment where you can thrive, keep reading!



Our Associate Salesforce Administrator will play a crucial role in optimizing and maintaining the Salesforce platform for the Department of Veterans Affairs. You will work closely with other administrators, developers, architects, business stakeholders, and end-users to understand requirements, implement changes, and ensure the smooth operation of Salesforce systems. This role offers an excellent opportunity for learning and growth in Salesforce administration and business process management. The successful candidate will have a basic understanding of Salesforce functionalities, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate with various stakeholders. We're seeking Salesforce team members to help modernize and enhance enterprise system that connects healthcare providers directly with millions of US veterans seeking care.



**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**



* Provide frontline support to Salesforce users, addressing inquiries, troubleshooting issues, and resolving user-reported problems.
* Assist in configuring Salesforce objects, fields, workflows, validation rules, and other system components to meet business requirements.
* Collaborate with other administrators and developers to implement customizations, integrations, and enhancements.
* Support data cleansing, deduplication, and migration activities to ensure data accuracy and integrity within Salesforce.
* Assist in creating and maintaining data reports, dashboards, and views to support business analytics and decision-making.
* Perform routine system maintenance tasks, including user provisioning, profile management, and permission set assignments.
* Monitor system performance, security, and compliance, addressing any issues or concerns as they arise.
* Document Salesforce configurations, processes, and procedures to maintain an up-to-date knowledge base.
* Stay informed about Salesforce updates, new features, and best practices, sharing insights with the team to drive continuous improvement.

 **KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS** **REQUIRED****:**



* Basic understanding of Salesforce platform fundamentals, including data model, security model, and declarative customization options.
* Familiarity with Salesforce Lightning Experience and related technologies.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Eagerness to learn and grow in the field of Salesforce administration and technology.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

 **KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS DESIRED:**



* Salesforce Administrator certification preferred, or willingness to obtain certification.
* Experience working with Federal agencies is a plus.

 **EDUCATION:**



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or related field.

 **CLEARANCE:**



* Must be a US Citizen.
* Must be able to obtain and maintain a Public Trust clearance.

 **WORK LOCATION:**



* Remote
**Technatomy** **Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is the policy of** **Technatomy** **Corporation to afford equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, disability or veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.**

title: Azure Cloud Infrastructure Architect - 100% remote
description:
Cloud AI Infrastructure engineering involves the design, deployment, maintenance, and servicing of Cloud infrastructure underpinning AI and Machine Learning (ML) SaaS implementations for safe and secure construction and deployment of AI services by AI and ML engineers. Rather than building the data models or implementing the AI service, Cloud AI Infrastructure engineering creates safe spaces for AI engineers to build data models which enable ChatBots, AI Search, Machine Learning and similar services which are performant for thousands of users, avoiding data leakage between models and services.

Required Qualifications

· 6+ years of experience in Azure cloud environments.

· Microsoft Azure Certified Solution Architect

· Microsoft Azure Certified AI Fundamentals

· Customer focused with experience leading technical discussions with stakeholders and driving solutions to successful implementations.

· 3+ years of experience using the Azure CLI, PowerShell Az, and ARM templates to deploy, configure, and manage Azure resources.

· Highly experienced in implementing and troubleshooting foundational Azure services (virtual machines, storage, networking, monitoring, databases, etc.).

· Experience generating complex automation supporting systems administration of cloud services

· Familiarity with AI Cloud Concepts

Preferred Qualifications

· At least two Associate-level (or higher) Microsoft Cloud certifications such as Azure Solution Architect, Azure AI Engineer Associated, or Azure Network Engineer

· Team player, confident and enthusiastic; proven partner engagement and cross-team collaboration skills.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to simplify and explain complex ideas.

· Experience writing and maintaining clear and concise technical documentation.

· Expert level knowledge in Azure Core Services.

· Experience implementing Azure Cloud environments consisting of multiple services in line with the Microsoft Well Architected Framework.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $170,000.00 - $245,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 6 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Job Title**: Solutions Architect  
**Location:** Remote  
**Duration:** Full Time

**Required Skills:**

* Solution Architect - Application Integration Architecture FHIR (HL7) experience required Design FHIR Schema (JSON, S3) API and Application Integration Event driven Architecture using Pub Sub FHIR, SNS, SQS, S3 AppSync, Event Bridge, NodeJS, TypeScript, Angular, RestAPI, Data Repositories – Mongo, DynamoDB, Lambda AWS, Lambda, Redshift, JSON, Python +ICS/IICS Healthcare Insurance Required Strong API experience – Authentication, Authorization, API Security + InterOperability from CMS (FHIR) + Document Management.

**Qualifications:** 

* Minimum 7 years’ experience in an IT environment, focusing on leading application solutions delivery and design.
* Extensive experience with application design, layering, and the concept of separation of concerns
* Familiarity with data storage types and their unique qualities that differentiate them from each other for specific use cases.
* Effective organizational and communication skills, with the ability to develop and deliver technical presentations and tailor content to audience as appropriate.
* Ability to provide overall direction, guidance, and definition of implementing the architecture that effectively supports the Corporate Business Strategy in the context of projects.
* Demonstrated experience providing effective consulting and influencing decisions through sound judgment and data analysis to effectively drive positive business outcomes and resolve complex issues
* Ability to influence, solicit cooperation, and action from others to educate, gain understanding and get buy-in.
* Collaborate with other architects; provide feedback on standards, assure constant compliance with architecture and design framework, and introduce and educate business and technology partners on approved technology.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills working with architecture peers as well as with other roles on projects. Must be able to find transitions to get to target state when timelines or other factors prevent achieving target state.
* Informal Leadership skills to assist development teams on new and difficult development techniques
* Candidate must have good to excellent familiarity with architectural patterns including data aggregation, integration, application architecture, event and process centric design, loose coupling, knowledge of architectural technologies/technology trends including cloud computing.
* Candidate must be a self-starter and must possess internal drive, informal leadership, and ability to take projects to completion.
* Experience using agile and waterfall SDLC.
* Prior leadership experience, through a combination of project or informal leadership that demonstrates those qualities.

**Preferred:** 

* Experience in creating reference implementations.
* Familiarity with TOGAF, Zachman, or other architecture frameworks.
* Cloud architecture with AWS or Azure.
* Application and Infrastructure design experience.
* Healthcare industry knowledge and experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Remote

title: ServiceNow Solution Architect
description:
Our SaaS practice has a fulltime, permanent opportunity for a ServiceNow Solutions Architect with solid consulting experience supporting successful ServiceNow implementation engagements for external clients.


**Work Style** :


* **Remote** : US - Candidates may be based anywhere in the United States.
* **Fulltime / Permanent**

**Fujitsu Right Now:**  

There's never been a more exciting time to work at Fujitsu - we are currently going through an unprecedented period of transformation and growth, adapting to what the world around us now demands. This transformation builds on our long-standing heritage of being the trusted technology partner of choice for many and will ensure that we continue to work intimately with both existing and new customers. Our focus now is ensuring we address the challenges of those customers in today’s FAST IT and digitally focused technology landscape. SaaS and ServiceNow are a big part of this focus for us.


**What we offer:**

* The opportunity to design and build ServiceNow solutions to multiple sectors both with our existing client base and new customers
* Unrivalled investment and training in you and your career
* Stimulating environment offering ongoing learning opportunities
* Culture of innovation and inspiration
* Competitive salary and generous benefits
* A very flexible and creative environment for everyone

**Role and Accountabilities:**  

  

This will suit an experienced ServiceNow professional with a successful recent track record leading and supporting a variety of ServiceNow implementation related projects.  



  

In addition to experience leading end to end ServiceNow engagements, the successful candidate will be responsible for, (but not limited to), the following duties:


* Expertise and delivery for ServiceNow based consulting initiatives.
* Define business problems/opportunities with constraints, goals, budgets and timelines
* Communicates technical problems and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Ability to convey complex technical concepts in understandable business terms
* Consults with business analyst/project manager to develop appropriate technical solutions
* Document and gain acceptance / approvals of selected final solutions
* Execute technical solutions in capacity as a ServiceNow lead, subject matter expert
* Mentor the technical teams

**Qualifications**

**Skills and Experience Requirements:**

* Minimum of 8 years of ServiceNow design and development experience
* Minimum 3 years of ServiceNow architecture experience
* At least two full lifecycle ServiceNow implementations in the role of a senior Architect
* Development experience on the ServiceNow platform including customization of applications such as ITSM, ITOM, ITAM, HRSD, SPM, CSM and GRC
* Strong consultative background in enterprise environments, should have worked closely with leadership on high visibility program-based initiatives.
* Experience in creating technical solutions for proposal development during procurement phases
* Experience with implementation of custom integrations (REST/SOAP, Flow Designer, Data Stream, Scripted REST API)
* Experience developing, implementing, and maintaining large-scale applications and systems.
* Ability to formulate and articulate technical vision.
* Must have strong requirements gathering experience.
* Proficient in all phases of the Application Development Lifecycle.
* Strong technical and leadership skills.
* Strong analytical and conceptual skills, with ability to function at both the conceptual as well as detail levels.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Proven track record in delivering complex technical products in the ServiceNow ecosystem
* Programming expertise in Java, JavaScript or other functional programming languages
* Demonstrated understanding of ITIL practices

**Skills and Certifications**

* Must hold a minimum of 2 ServiceNow certifications – eg: Certified Implementation Specialist Service Now System Administrator.
* ITIL v3 certification
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong communication skills in English.
* Strong presentation development and Customer Presentation skills
* Successful teamwork experience & demonstrated leadership abilities

title: Data Engineer
description:
Job Title: Data Engineer

Job Description:

We are currently seeking a talented Data Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a Data Engineer, you will be instrumental in designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines and infrastructure on cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud. Your expertise in programming languages including Python, Java, and Scala, coupled with proficiency in databases such as Azure Data Lake, MS-SQL, Apache, and Teradata, will be essential in ensuring the reliability, scalability, and efficiency of our data solutions.

Responsibilities:

1. Design, develop, and deploy robust and scalable data pipelines on cloud platforms including Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud.

2. Collaborate closely with data architects, data scientists, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions.

3. Utilize programming languages such as Python, Java, and Scala to implement ETL processes, data transformations, and data integration workflows.

4. Build and maintain data warehouses, data lakes, and other data storage solutions using databases including Azure Data Lake, MS-SQL, Apache, and Teradata.

5. Implement data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of data assets.

6. Optimize data processing and storage for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.

7. Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, identifying and resolving issues to ensure data availability and reliability.

8. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement best practices for data engineering and contribute to the continuous improvement of data infrastructure and processes.

Requirements:

1. Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

2. Proven experience in designing and implementing data pipelines and infrastructure on cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud.

3. Proficiency in programming languages including Python, Java, and Scala.

4. Strong understanding of databases such as Azure Data Lake, MS-SQL, Apache, and Teradata.

5. Experience with ETL tools and techniques for data extraction, transformation, and loading.

6. Familiarity with data modeling concepts and techniques.

7. Knowledge of data warehousing, data lakes, and big data technologies.

8. Experience with data governance, security, and compliance standards.

9. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

10. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.

This is an exciting opportunity for individuals passionate about data engineering and cloud technologies. If you have a strong background in data engineering and a desire to work in a collaborative and innovative environment, we encourage you to apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience with Federal agency?

Experience:

* Azure: 9 years (Required)
* AWS: 9 years (Required)
* Azure Data Lake: 9 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Solution Architect**  

*(Military Veterans are highly encouraged to apply)*  

  

**Role Overview**  

BDR Solutions, LLC seeks a Solution Architect to join the BDR Growth Team. The Solution Architect will be responsible for leading and designing technical solutions, processes, and staffing mix within the domains of systems engineering, data and business analytics, data science, cyber security, management consulting, healthcare IT, and program management to create and craft high-quality technical solutions for written proposals, white papers, client engagements, and oral presentations. This position will report to the Senior Vice President of Growth. The ideal candidate will have experience serving in leadership roles on Federal IT proposals with prior experience serving as a technical solution architect or technical capture manager.  

  

**Responsibilities*** Assess technical requirements and objectives and design technical IT and management solutions applying industry best practices, frameworks, and technologies (e.g., DAMA DMBOK, Agile, Cloud, DevSecOps, low-code/no-code platforms, AI/ML, etc.) resulting in tailored solutions for integration into the written technical proposal, white papers, client presentations, and oral presentations.
* Apply analytics, problem-solving, and communication skills to identify best-fit technology solutions aligned to client requirements to deliver winning proposals to federal civilian, federal health, and other federal markets.
* Architect and design innovative, cost-effective technical solutions that meet and exceed customer requirements.
* Design approaches that optimize enterprise architecture across customer needs, business constraints, and technological implementation feasibility.
* Provide technical leadership and consulting level support on industry trends and standards on business and technical solutions.
* Provide facilitation for collaborative calls with partners, internal staff, and clients.
* Collect and process strategic plans, goals, and objectives for Veterans Affairs (VA), Department of Homeland Security, Department of Defense, and other Federal agencies.
* Collaborate with BDR Growth and Operations teams leading technical direction to support the business development lifecycle including pre-sales, capture, and proposal.
* Create technical solutions for proposals and manage technical response development by partnering with contributors from various internal and external teams via virtual and/or in-person meetings.
* Research and provide context and feasibility of solutions relative to customer business needs
* Support project start-up by performing technical interviews for resources to deliver work assignments.
* Lead technical aspects of the capture lifecycle including pre-proposal planning activities, kick-off meetings, value proposition conveyance, theme development, technical solution feasibility, technical writing, and technical reviews.
* Review/analyze proposal sections for consistency and clarity: Compliance with solicitation requirements, and alignment with proposed solutions and themes.
* Collaboratively work with business development, R&D, and operational leadership to obtain adequate resources for accomplishing high-quality proposal development in a timely manner.
* Ongoing improvements: Assist in the development and refinement of templates and standardized processes to streamline proposal development.

**Required Minimum Qualifications*** Demonstrate a minimum of 8+ years of experience in solution delivery, implementation, or engineering within DevSecOps, SDLC, Agile, Cloud optimization, and/or emerging technologies/capabilities (e.g., AI/ML, RPA, ZTA, etc.).
* In-depth business and technical knowledge of technology trends and standards in government IT and digital services transformation
* Experience leading technical discussions including the ability to take part in persuasive discourse with peers, partners, capture, pricing, and executive leadership
* Proven experience to architect technical solutions based on client requirements
* Ability to manage several proposals, projects, and priorities
* Experience and expertise within the Federal IT market space
* High level of expertise in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint).
* Proven excellent oral and written communication.

**Ideal Experience*** Proven experience working in a pace environment with a successful track record supporting proposals under VA T4NG, GSA MAS99 54151S, STARS III, and CIO-SP3.
* Dynamic interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of audiences (e.g., Executive management, subcontractors, technical and management staff)
* Demonstrated experience communicating clearly orally and in writing, and producing high-quality written products.
* Strong relationships with technology vendors or service providers


In addition, U.S. citizenship is required. Individuals will be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.  

BDR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.  

  

  

**About BDR Solutions:**  

  

BDR Solutions delivers IT expertise and solutions that improve American lives through the modernization of government systems for health benefits, social services, and disaster relief. We are a service-disabled veteran-owned, 8(a), HUBZone small business—recognized for reliable and sustainable outcomes scaled to our client’s mission needs.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Are you passionate about making a difference in people's lives? Do you enjoy working in a service-oriented industry? If so, this opportunity may be the right fit for you!
Modivcare is looking for an experienced UX/UI Designer. In this role, you will help establish the user experience by designing digital features and products for Modivcare. You will work with other UX/UI Designers, Delivery teams, and team members to help guide the company in accomplishing the vision for a bold and cohesive user experience across all products. You will report to a Director or Manager of Software Engineering.*Please note this is an "Evergreen" position which is used to build our candidate pool but is not a role that is open at this time. That said, we encourage you to apply to be a part of our talent community. By having your information on file, we can reach out to you when this (or a similar role) officially opens.*
You will...* Implement creative design deliverables for web-based and mobile platforms. Designs will address aspects of high-level interaction, navigation, and organization across one or more assigned platforms to satisfy user goals and improve engagement.
* Handoff designs to your Delivery Team(s), including such formats as wireframes, mock-ups, functional demos, presentations, and annotated specifications.
* Work with your Product Owner to conduct user research efforts, including: surveys, usability studies, design thinking sessions, and competitive research.
* Present research findings and design work to peers, partners, and executives for review and feedback, explaining how design solution answers user needs, business goals, technical constraints, and other project facets.
* Revise and iterate designs and documentation based on continued user testing and feedback.
* Enforce UX/UI design consistency across platforms.


We are interested in speaking with individuals with the following...* Bachelor's degree, certificate from a UX/UI program, or equivalent experience.
* 3+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, visual designer, or similar UX/UI-related role.
* Experience with the following:
	+ Figma
	+ Zeplin
	+ Adobe Creative Cloud
* Knowledge of eCommerce, mobile app, industry trends, and competitor innovations.
* Can work with geographically distributed teams.
* Can present and "sell" creative ideas to influence decisions.
* Knowledge of inclusive design principles, accessibility standards, and general design best practices.
* Can provide a portfolio/work examples that highlight design process.


Salary: 56,200.00 - 77,300.00
Modivcare’s positions are posted and open for applications for a minimum of 5 days. Positions may be posted for a maximum of 45 days dependent on the type of role, the number of roles, and the number of applications received. We encourage our prospective candidates to submit their application(s) expediently so as not to miss out on our opportunities. We frequently post new opportunities and encourage prospective candidates to check back often for new postings.  

We value our team members and realize the importance of benefits for you and your family.
Modivcare offers a comprehensive benefits package to include the following:* Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
* Employer Paid Basic Life Insurance and AD&D
* Voluntary Life Insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)
* Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts

Pre-Tax and Post * -Tax Commuter and Parking Benefits
* 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with Company Match
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Parental Leave
* Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Discounts (retail, hotel, food, restaurants, car rental and much more!)

*Modivcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer.** EEO is The Law - click here for more information
* Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
* We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, handicap or disability, or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran in accordance with federal law. If you need assistance, please reach out to us at hr.recruiting@modivcare.com

title: Contractor – Solution Architecture
description:
Contractor – Remote
Work you'll do  

  

* Providing technical and architectural leadership for Microsoft .NET web applications by leveraging AWS Cloud services
* Create Architecture and Design documentation for the applications and present them to the review board
* Collaborating frequently with clients to provide cloud solutions and assistance; and working with these customers to understand their requirements for cloud implementations that add the most value to their business.
* Create functional design specifications, AWS reference architectures, design documents and assist with other project deliverables as needed.
* Design state-of-the-art technical solutions on AWS that address customers' requirements for scalability, reliability, security, and performance and leverage existing investments in AWS platforms.
* Designing, developing, implementing, and releasing high quality custom software solutions using Scrum.
* Creating project and application architecture deliverables that are consistent with architecture principles, standards, methodologies, and best practices.
* Leading technical design sessions with the development teams, including the creation of class models, sequence diagrams, component models, etc., and detailed design specifications to ensuring that architecture standards are followed.
* Applying the very best technical agile patterns and practices when building custom software solutions.
* Working under some supervision from a Solution Architect, but will be expected to work independently on complex, non-routine tasks and projects. You may interact with end users and other technical personnel to identify and correct issues.
* Maintain continuous, open, consistent professional communication with customers, peers and team members. Openly listen to others and confirm understanding to ensure everyone is on the same page.
* Reviewing and approving 3rd party and integration solution architecture based on established enterprise application strategy.
* Communicating implications of architectural decisions, issues and plans to business and IT Leadership.
* Defining and validating non-functional (technical) requirements, and establishing traceability between requirements and application architecture/design.
* Providing support / guidance to the development teams during the analysis, development, and testing processes.
* Providing input to the development of project initiation documents including objectives, scope, approach, estimates, and deliverables, when needed.
* Working closely with Performance Engineering and our Web/Infrastructure Technology teams on defining the deployment architecture.
* Learn, learn, and learn by staying up-to-date on all technical developments related to AWS and other public cloud platforms.

 **Qualifications:**


 Required:

* Strong knowledge and understanding of .NET Framework development techniques
* Working knowledge of web-based technologies; HTTP, AJAX, HTML5, JavaScript/jQuery and CSS3
* Microsoft .Net, ASP.NET Web API and complementary business layer and front-end technologies.
* Microsoft SQL Server and other most common backend Microsoft technologies

**The expected pay range for this contract assignment is $85-$100 per hour.** **The e****xact pay rate will vary based on skills, experience****,** **and location and** **will be** **determined by the third-party whose employees provid****e** **services to Deloitte.**

 **Candidates interested in applying for this opportunity must be geographically based in the United States and must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship**

 **We do not accept agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.**

 **Deloitte is not the employer for this role. This work is contracted through a third-party whose employees provides services to Deloitte.**

#Remote


#LI-CJ2

Approximate hours per week

Our inclusive culture empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively. It makes Deloitte one of the most rewarding places to work.

title: Network Architect
description:
About Us

We are a team of Architects, Senior Data, Application, and System Engineers, recognized for our elite capabilities in guiding clients worldwide through their digital transformation, data modernization, and cloud migration journeys. Our focus, predominantly in the data space, extends into a comprehensive array of services, including network infrastructure projects which are pivotal for our client's success in today's digital economy.

The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated CCIE Network Infrastructure Engineer to join our team on a contract basis. This is a unique opportunity to work with an elite group of professionals on cutting-edge projects. The role is fully remote, offering the flexibility to work from anywhere, designed for an individual ready to make an immediate impact.

Duration & Availability

* **Contract Length:** 6-12 months, full-time engagement
* **Start Date:** Within 2-3 weeks from the job posting, with a preference for near-immediate availability

Key Responsibilities

* Design, implement, and manage complex network infrastructure projects with a strong focus on Cisco Nexus series (9500, 9600, 9300) and Cisco ITD.
* Develop and maintain high-security network environments, incorporating Palo Alto firewalls and advanced load balancing techniques.
* Work closely with clients to architect and deploy network infrastructure that supports digital transformation, data warehouse modernization, and cloud migration initiatives.
* Lead projects with minimal oversight, demonstrating a strong ability to manage time, resources, and project deliverables.
* Collaborate with a team of elite Architects, Engineers, and Analysts to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions.

Requirements

* **Certification:** Current CCIE certification is mandatory.
* **Experience:** Proven experience with Cisco Nexus 9500, 9600, 9300 series, and Cisco ITD. Strong background in managing Palo Alto firewalls and load balancing within complex environments.
* **Skills:** Exceptional technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fully remote setting. Strong communication and leadership qualities, capable of guiding teams and leading projects to success.
* **Contract Type:** Open to 1099 or Corporate-to-Corporate arrangements.

Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate is a forward-thinking leader, eager to take charge and drive projects forward. You are highly experienced, with a knack for staying ahead in your field, constantly seeking opportunities for growth and development. Your expertise enables you to navigate complex environments with ease, making you a valuable asset to any project.

Why Join Us?

Joining our team means being part of an organization that values innovation and leadership. We offer a dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact our success and the success of our clients. This role is an excellent opportunity to expand your skills, work on challenging projects, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $80.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT
description:
Location: North Dallas or Santa Clara, CA


Salary Range: $125,000- $150,000/yr


Department: Field Engineering & Customer Integration


We are seeking an experienced Solutions Architect to join our team in deploying the next generation of Identity and Access Management technology – Continuous Adaptive Trust. As a Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for pre-sales designing, post-sales implementing, and integration of our passwordless and continuous authentication solutions. You will work closely with our sales, development, and project management teams to ensure that our solutions align with client requirements and industry best practices.


**Responsibilities**:


* Collaborate with sales teams to identify and understand client requirements and propose appropriate solutions within our client environments.
* Design and architect solutions, including hardware, software, and network components, that meet client needs and align with industry best practices.
* Develop detailed solution architecture documents, including system diagrams, network diagrams, and technical specifications.
* Provide guidance and oversight to development teams to ensure that solutions are implemented according to the agreed-upon architecture.
* Identify and mitigate risks associated with solution design and implementation.
* Communicate technical concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry best practices, and recommend new technologies and methodologies to improve our solutions.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Proven experience as a Solutions Architect, with a minimum of 5-10 years of mid-senior level experience in designing and implementing complex IT solutions.
* Strong understanding of Identity and Access Management, cloud-based architectures, and
* containerization technologies.
* Experience with various development frameworks.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies.
* Relevant certifications such as AWS Solutions Architect are a plus.


If you are a highly motivated and experienced Solutions Architect looking for an exciting new opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter for consideration. This position may require frequent travel within and outside of the United States.


TruU is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and do not discriminate based on Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

title: Presales Solutions Architect - AWS
description:
Accepting remote candidates in the following states: Arizona, California, Colorado, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Maryland, Minnesota, Nevada, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Washington, and Wisconsin.

Requires up to 25% travel.

The TensorIoT Solutions Architect team partners with our customers and AWS to design and build some of the world's most modern cloud architectures and solutions. TensorIoT Solutions Architects collaborate with each other and their respective Sales counterparts to address customer challenges, oftentimes working together to formulate a solution for a given challenge.

A TensorIoT Solutions Architect assists the Customer with bridging the gap between business goals and technology solutions. As the customer’s trusted technical advocate, Solutions Architects not only help organizations small and large understand best practices around advanced machine learning and cloud based solutions, but also provide insight into areas such as migrations, modernizing existing infrastructure or applications, and building new and innovative solutions using cutting edge services.

As a Solutions Architect, you will have the unique opportunity to assist customers in shaping the future of their business. In order to accomplish this, you will be in constant communication with TensorIoT Delivery practice managers and industry and area-of-depth experts to help shape and execute the strategy to realize the customer’s overarching vision.

The TensorIoT Solutions Architect team is committed to ensuring harmony of both work and life. We do this by allowing for autonomy in your day to day activities, focusing more on the solutions and outcomes driven by customer obsession to steer your work day. Since we serve customers all over the world, expect up to 25% travel. While there are TensorIoT offices available in select locations, the Solutions Architecture team works primarily remotely. Work hours are very flexible and typically are driven by your workload.

We’re looking for someone who has:

* 2+ years of design, implementation, or consulting experience in AWS application or infrastructure
* 4+ years within specific technology domain areas (Gen AI, ML/AI, IoT)
* Technical degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience
* 4+ years developing technology solutions in the cloud
* Experience building out CDK scripts, CloudFormation and Terraform templates, and architecting production-grade enterprise-scale applications on AWS.
* Strong familiarity with one of the following languages: Python, Java, Javascript, Nodejs
* At least 1 AWS Professional or Specialty certification
* Willing to do up to 25% travel to customer sites. Will be in front of customers, holding POCs, demos, and working with sales teams.
* 2+ Years customer-facing experience in a pre-sales engineering role
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to articulate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
* The ability to create and present detailed reports and presentations.
* Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with different teams and stakeholders.
* Time management and organizational skills to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* Adaptability and willingness to learn new tools and techniques as needed.

What we offer:

* Competitive salary based on experience
* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
* 401k plan with matching
* Unlimited PTO
* Flexible work hours and the ability to work from home

About TensorIoT

TensorIoT is an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner. We help companies realize the value and efficiency of the AWS ecosystem. From building PoCs and MVPs to production-ready applications, we are tackling complex business problems every day and developing solutions to drive customer success.

TensorIoT's founders helped build world-class IoT and AI platforms at AWS and Google, and are now creating solutions to simplify the way enterprises incorporate edge devices and their data into their day to day operations. Our mission is to help connect devices and make them intelligent. Our founders firmly believe in the transformative potential of smarter devices to enhance our quality of life, and we're just getting started!

TensorIoT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. This means that we are committed to diversity and inclusion, and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and make our hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $170,000.00 per year

Travel requirement:

* Up to 25% travel

Experience:

* AI: 2 years (Required)
* IoT: 2 years (Required)
* serverless: 2 years (Required)
* Architecting solutions on AWS: 2 years (Required)
* crafting SoW presentations: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* AWS Certification (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: AI Machine Learning Developer - South East Asia
description:
**Opportunities:*** Competitive hourly rate: **AUD 35 - AUD 50 per hour (based on experience and location)**
* **Australian Time Zone**
* **Fully Remote - Work From Home**
* Opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects
* Collaborative and supportive work environment
* Opportunities for professional development and growth

  

**About the Role:**  

  

As an AI Machine Learning Developer, you'll be at the forefront of innovation, designing and developing intelligent solutions powered by machine learning algorithms. You'll collaborate with a talented team to tackle challenging problems, analyze data, build predictive models, and implement them in real-world applications. This role demands strong technical skills, a sharp analytical mind, and a thirst for knowledge.  

  

This position is initially envisioned to be a part-time role, but may progress into a full-time role.  

  

**Your Responsibilities:*** Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models for various applications.
* Preprocess and analyze large datasets using various tools and techniques.
* Select and implement appropriate machine learning algorithms based on project requirements.
* Evaluate and optimize model performance to ensure accuracy and efficiency.
* Integrate machine learning models with existing systems and applications.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of AI and machine learning.
* Collaborate with engineers, data scientists, and other stakeholders to deliver successful projects.

Document your work clearly and concisely.  
* 

**We're looking for someone who:*** Possesses 3+ years of experience as an AI Machine Learning Developer or similar role.
* Holds a strong understanding of machine learning concepts, algorithms, and techniques.
* Has experience with popular machine learning libraries and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
* Demonstrates proficiency in programming languages like Python.
* Possesses excellent data analysis and manipulation skills.
* Is a problem-solver with a critical and analytical mind.
* Thrives in a collaborative and fast-paced environment.
* Enjoys taking initiative and working independently.
* Has excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Has a passion for learning and staying ahead of the technology curve.

  

**About the company**  

  

Freedom Property Investors is the largest and fastest growing Property Investment Company in Australia, with main offices in Sydney and Melbourne CBD’s.  

  

We are currently the 3rd fastest-growing business in Australia across all industries according to the Australian Financial Review.  

  

We are privileged to have 25+ years combined experience between our two Founders, over 7,500 valued members, and over 250+ full-time staff spread across Australia and growing. We pride ourselves on being the industry leaders.  

  

It is our mission to serve our valued members, earning over 1,521+ positive Google reviews and a 4.8 Star rating, this is unheard of in our industry. We are in need of people who share the same values as we do.  

  

Come join Australia's Number 1 Property Investment Advisory. Apply now!!!

description:

==================

title: Virtual Chief Information Officer (MSP Company)
description:
**Are you looking for limit-less career opportunities? Do you have a growth mindset, and like to take initiative?**If yes, then Ntiva is the right place for you! At Ntiva, we have a saying – “We exist to grow each other.” Our focus is helping each other, our clients and our families grow both personally and professionally. Sound like something you could get in to? Because as one of the fastest-growing Managed Services Companies in the country, we’re looking to fuel our team with powerhouse talent. With strategic locations across the U.S., and still led by our original founder Steven Freidkin, we specialize in in helping organizations solve their complex IT challenges no matter where they are located. Definitely a fast-paced environment where we collectively battle escalating cyber-attacks and stay on top of fast changing technologies! Come explore one of our many opportunities!

**How you’ll make an Impact**   
As vCIO you will provide executive level guidance for Information Technology (IT) and act as an extension of the client’s organization. You will be responsible for developing, managing, and supporting the client’s long-term IT Vision and Strategies. The vCIO works closely with Account Managers and IT Advisors at Ntiva and advises the client on technology, infrastructure, management, and productivity as they relate to their information technology capabilities.

**Summary of Location and Hours**

* This is a 100% remote role
* Monday – Friday, 8am-5pm CST

**What you will be doing**

* Serve as the client’s trusted strategic technology advisor providing strategic technical leadership and consulting to the client’s departments and staff
* Understand and learn the client’s industry and business to provide valuable insights around operational process improvements
* Develop, manage and support the company’s strategic IT vision, initiatives, polices, assets, training, dashboard/metrics, and more.
* Develop and manage a three-to-five-year strategic technology roadmap to align technology solutions with business goals and objectives
* Responsible for preparing and presenting a comprehensive IT Budget
* Establish and manage IT vendor relationships
* Meet regularly with stakeholders to ensure satisfaction with current work and plan for future growth
* Manage client-wide IT communication and presentations
* Complete various short-term client projects based off of vCIO recommendation
* Participate with and Support Account Managers and Solution Architects on strategic guidance to better serve their assigned clients

**You’ll be successful in this role if you have** 

* 7+ Years of experience in successfully designing, implementing and IT Consulting
* Proficiency in establishing IT services framework and IT security policies
* Experience with project management
* Experience with budget management
* Aptitude for customer engagement analysis
* Ability to establish partnerships with service providers and vendors
* Experience in due diligence when assessing a company’s IT environment
* Ability to monitor and understand technology trends and tap the knowledge of technology experts
* Strong writing and organized documentation/reporting skills
* Ability to deal with various different personalities and to build strong relationships with client executives, department leads, and team members
* Attention to detail
* Desire to do what is right and best for the client

 **Required language skills**

* Ability to communicate professionally, in English, both written and orally
* Ability to write business correspondence and process procedures
* Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, and the general public

**Bonus points for**

* A Bachelor's degree or Master's degree, preferably related to Information Technology
* Microsoft Azure or M365 certifications (or equivalent)
* Experience in an MSP Environment
* Experience in Connectwise
* Highly skilled in working autonomously as well in cross-functional environments
* Other skills and expertise that can be useful include the following
* Legal expertise
* Corporate finance
* Data management
* Compliance
* Security

**Benefits and Perks**

* Medical, Dental and Vision coverage for employee and family
* 401k + company matched contributions 4% match on 5% contribution – Employee and Company contribute after 90 days – no vesting period!)
* Group Term Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment coverage (company provided)
* Short-Term (voluntary enrollment) and Long-Term Disability coverage (company provided)
* Health Savings Account (HSA) Options / PPO Options
* Paid Personal Time Off (PTO) + 2 Floating Holidays
* Bonus plans
* Tuition Reimbursement Program
* Employee Assistance Program
* Generous Employee Referral Program – the more you refer the more you earn!
* Dynamic Recognition and Rewards
* Work with Industry-Leading Talent
* Clear Promotion and Advancement Tracks

The base pay range for this position is expected to be between $90,000 and $120,000.00 per year, plus an annual on-target bonus. The base pay offered may vary depending on multiple non-discriminatory factors including, but not limited to, market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position also includes medical benefits, 401(k) eligibility, and PTO. Additional details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

At Ntiva, we are committed to creating and maintaining a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming work environment for all employees and job applicants. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters a wider range of perspectives, experiences, and ideas that lead to increased creativity, innovation, and problem-solving capabilities. As an equal opportunity employer, we actively seek to recruit and retain a diverse workforce that reflects the communities we serve. We prohibit discrimination of any kind, including but not limited to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and comply with all applicable laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

**Application Deadline:** The sooner you apply, the sooner we can get to know you! Submit your resume today! Applications will be accepted until 03/19/2024.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you require sponsorship for employment with the U.S.?
* Do you have experience working in the MSP space?

Work Location: Remote

title: Cloud Innovation Architect - Live Production - Virtual
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.
  
Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:
  
* Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA
* Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world
* Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY
* Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe


Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
  
  

What part will you play?
  
Diversified is seeking a skilled and experienced Cloud Innovation Architect for Live Production to help architect, design, and build cloud-based solutions for live broadcast production workflows on cloud platforms. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in architecting and deploying complex solutions, with a focus on live production, channel playout, and content delivery. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience building secure and resilient cloud infrastructure and environments and have a deep understanding of service offerings on different cloud platforms.
  
What will you be doing?
  
* Work as a platform administrator (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.) to support the needs of our solutions architects and engineers as they develop solutions.
* Collaborate with our engineering, operations, and product teams to identify requirements for cloud-based solutions that meet the needs of our live broadcast production and post-production workflows.
* Design and architect cloud-based solutions for live broadcast production workflows, channel playout, and content delivery
* Take on the role of subject matter expert on security standards and security best practices such as “least privilege”, NIST 800-53, SOC 2, etc.
* Support the develop and implement scalable, secure, and high-performing solutions on Cloud platforms.
* Work with cross-functional teams to ensure that solutions are optimized for cost, performance, and reliability.
* Maintain, enhance, and own existing cloud-based solutions, improving performance, reliability, and security.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to other team members.
* Experience building complex networking infrastructure on premises.


What do we require from you?
  
  

**Education/Certifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent work experience
* AWS Solutions Architect Associate or higher certification


**Required/Desired Knowledge, Experience and Skills:**  

* 5-7 years progressive professional experience
* At least 3 years of experience in architecting, designing, and implementing cloud-based solutions. These includes Live Production Platforms, Master Control, Channel Playout, and others.
* Experience with architecting to NIST 800-53, SOC 2, and other security compliance standards.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
* Self-motivated and capable of working in a remote work environment.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Deep experience with Cloud Formation, Hashi Corp stack, Jira, Lucid Chart and Lucid Spark, GitHub, and other DevOps tools.
* Experience with third-party solutions and services commonly used in the live broadcast media and entertainment industry.
* Cloud certifications such those from GCP, Azure, Oracle, Tata, etc.
* Security certification such as CCSP, CISSP, ect.
* Experience with post-production workflows such as edit in the cloud, storage, and database is a plus.


To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.
  
  

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at careers@onediversified.com.
